page.title: 10BURWASH CAR PARK
page.content: At the edge of the Car Park in Burwash there is a Scout Hut, where the the Cubs meet too. The Public car Park is adjacent to the Bear's own car park. The other facilities are Toilets, two Bottle Banks and three Bins. There are lots of lines marked on the tarmac to show the drivers where to park. At the back of the Scout Hut there is a path that will take you to Bateman's, the house where Rudyard Kipling once lived. Here too through the trees at the back of the car park cows can be seen chewing the cud and at the front, is the narrow crowded High Street. The Car Park is very busy all day long but when the shops close you can park quite easily, I know because Mum drops me off for scouts. We lay signs for other patrols and track all the way back to the car park
